content: Nirmal Eswar Vee - Software & AI Engineer Software & AI Engineer Specialising in Healthcare Analytics & Machine Learning Get in Touch View Projects About Me Currently pursuing a BSc in Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence at the University of Sheffield, while working part-time as a Software and Data Engineer at Clatterbridge Cancer Trust. Naive POS Tagger Project Project Overview This project implements a naive part-of-speech (POS) tagger using Python, which assigns POS tags to words based on training data frequencies. The tagger also uses heuristics to handle unknown words, improving accuracy when evaluated on a test dataset. Project Details Objective: To build a simple POS tagger and evaluate its accuracy by comparing tagged words against a gold-standard test dataset. Training Data: Processes training data to build a lexicon that maps each word to its most frequent POS tag. Tagging Approach: Uses the most common tag per word for known words and assigns the overall most common tag to unknown words. Heuristics for Unknown Words: Tags numbers as CD (cardinal numbers). Tags capitalized words as NNP (proper nouns). Uses suffix

cues (e.g., -ing , -ly ) to assign likely POS tags for words ending in specific patterns. Evaluation: Calculates accuracy by comparing predicted POS tags with the actual tags in the test data, providing insight into the tagger's effectiveness.

Global Engineering Challenge Project Overview Worked in a team to develop a solution for solving the energy crisis in Malta with renewable energy sources. Project Details Conducted project risk assessments, ensuring a strategic approach to development. Delivered a successful final pitch to communicate the project’s value and impact.

Dissertation Project Dissertation Project Investigating memorization in recurrent neural networks (RNNs) to demonstrate that memorization is not capped due to numerical instability. Project Details Investigating memorization in recurrent neural networks (RNNs) to demonstrate that memorization is not capped due to numerical instability. Developing a proof of concept that regenerates historical states using matrix inversion and invertible non-linearity. Exploring methods to maintain stability while increasing sequence length and efficiently compressing information into limited states. Putting the theory into simulation using Python to prove my hypotheses. View on GitHub

IBM AI Group Project: Paradroid Game Project Overview Collaborated effectively with a dynamic team to develop a tool for IBM that taught their users about AI. Project Details Developed a retro-style action game inspired by the original Paradroid, incorporating custom artwork and music. Created a comprehensive requirements document using the MoSCoW prioritization technique, outlining must-have, should-have, could-have, and won't-have features agreed upon with the client. Designed and implemented game mechanics including: Quiz System: Players answer questions related to IBM Skills Build topics (AI, Data Science, Threat Hunting) to take control of enemies. Shooting Mechanic: Introduced flexible shooting angles for enhanced gameplay. Enemy Behavior: Implemented patrol and chase mechanics with

dynamic voice lines. Teleportation: Developed a teleport system between game floors with user-friendly animations and prompts. Integrated accessibility features to ensure inclusivity for players with color blindness, along with a clear user manual. Created a save/load system allowing players to maintain their progress. Conducted extensive testing with beta testers, receiving positive feedback on gameplay and performance.

Trains of Sheffield Online Store Project Overview Developed an online store for Trains of Sheffield, allowing customers to browse model railway products, create orders, and manage banking details. Project Details Designed a user-friendly interface that enables customers to easily navigate product categories, view details, and add items to their order. Implemented a robust authentication system for customer and staff registration, ensuring secure login and personal information management. Created a staff area for inventory management, allowing staff to add, edit, and delete products while updating stock levels automatically. Integrated an order management system that tracks order status (pending, confirmed, fulfilled) and allows customers to confirm their orders with banking details. Establ
ished a manager role with exclusive permissions to promote or demote staff members, ensuring a secure user role hierarchy.

NHS PowerApps Application Project Overview Developed an intuitive PowerApps application for consultants at the Clatterbridge Cancer Trust, allowing them to manage their apps more effectively. The application provides a streamlined and user-friendly interface to enhance their workflow. Prev Next Key Features Apps gallery with icons, names, and descriptions. Favourite, request access, and run action buttons. Search bar for quick app access. Personalized request access functionality with confirmation pop-ups. Technologies Used Microsoft PowerApps Power Automate Unfortunately, I can't link to the github page for this project as it's now intellectual property of the hospital
